intro: Lasianthera tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant has four stamens, which is reflected in its specific epithet "tetrandra," and its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland dune environments. Due to its low water requirements, it is well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
